title: Projects & Case Studies
text:
Leadership in Quick Service — Firehouse Subs (Tsawwassen)



Firehouse Subs storefront


Context. Busy suburban location with high lunchtime traffic and strict opening SLAs.
Role. Opening shift lead coordinating prep, food safety checks, and first‑hour throughput.
Key actions. - Ran checklist‑driven open: equipment warm‑up, line setup, ingredient temp checks. - Delegated prep by station; verified labeling and FIFO rotation. - Oversaw front counter & POS, resolved order issues, and supported new team members. - Ensured presentation consistency and store readiness before the first rush.
Outcome. Reliable open, fewer last‑minute reworks, and smoother guest flow during peak hour.



Customer Experience Notes (Mini Case)

Clarified orders and recommended add‑ons when appropriate.
Proactively managed wait‑time expectations during peak periods.
Maintained a positive tone, especially when handling complaints.
